text: Ashokamitran (September 22, 1931 â€“ March 23, 2017) was the pen name of Jagadisa Thyagarajan, an Indian writer. He was sometimes called one of the most influential figures in post-independent Tamil literature. He began his prolific literary career with the prize winning play "Anbin Parisu" and went on to author more than two hundred short stories, and a dozen novellas and novels. Ashokamitran died on 23 March 2017 in Chennai from cardiac arrest at the age of 85. ==References== ==Other websites== * Ashokamitran page in Tamil Friends * Ashokamitran Special edition by Solvanam * B.
